Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/RobKnop>@RobKnop</denchmark-link> thanks for trying out the conversion script. Though that might have been bad advice. The conversion should happen under the hood. I could reproduce your bug with minimal code inside haystack by doing: <denchmark-code>reader = FARMReader(model_name_or_path="twmkn9/albert-base-v2-squad2", use_gpu=False) reader.save("data/albert-temp") reader2 = FARMReader(model_name_or_path="data/albert-temp", use_gpu=False) </denchmark-code>
So I opened an issue there <denchmark-link:https://github.com/deepset-ai/haystack/issues/49>deepset-ai/haystack/issues/49</denchmark-link> and we will fix it. Thanks for reporting! As a quick work-around (where you might need internet access) you could load the model by using the Huggingface model name "twmkn9/albert-base-v2-squad2" as before and continue training with this model. The model should be cached if you downloaded it before on the same machine. Hope that helps.

Hey! I am trying to load a locally saved Transformers model into the FARMReader. This is important to my project since the FARMReader seems to perform significantly better than the TransformersReader. Has there been any progress in allowing local Transformers models to be compatible with the FARMReader? Or are there any workarounds?

The only way I see is to load your model into FARM, then save it as a FARMmodel, then load it in haystack as a FARMReader. You should be able to do all this to your local transformers model with (Please adjust the parameters accordingly): <denchmark-code> model = AdaptiveModel.convert_from_transformers(model_name_or_path, device=device, task_type="question_answering")
tokenizer = Tokenizer.load(pretrained_model_name_or_path=model_name_or_path,do_lower_case=do_lower_case) processor = SquadProcessor( tokenizer=tokenizer, max_seq_len=256, label_list= ["start_token", "end_token"], metric="squad", train_filename=None, dev_filename=None, dev_split=0, test_filename=evaluation_filename, data_dir=data_dir, doc_stride=128, ) model.connect_heads_with_processor(data_silo.processor.tasks, require_labels=True)
model.save(save_dir) processor.save(save_dir) </denchmark-code>
Nice! Always happy to help, thanks for reporting back here.
